intro: Linaria brachyceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers with four petals, resembling those of the common toadflax. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Linaria brachyceras is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
